### What to do for Week 10 after class ends

```{r eval = TRUE, echo = FALSE}
unchecked <- as.character(fontawesome::fa("square", fill = "#4682b4"))

checked <- as.character(fontawesome::fa("square-check", fill = "#4682b4"))

wk_post <- tibble(
  
Submit = c(unchecked,
           unchecked,
           unchecked,
           checked,
           checked, 
           checked,
           checked,
           checked),

Description = c("Review the solution set from the Chapter 8 homework set",
                "Download a copy of the R walkthrough on the <i>t-test</i>",
                "Download a copy of the R bonus walkthrough on the `compareGroups`",
                "Complete problems 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 in Chapter 9",
                "Continue the <i>Foundations of Inference</i>",
                "Begin or continue the first <b><i>optional</i></b>  extra credit module <i>Analyzing Survey Data in R</i>",
                "Begin or continue the second <b><i>optional</i></b> extra credit module <i>Fundamentals of Bayesian Data Analysis in R</i>",
                "Begin or continue the third <b><i>optional</i></b>  extra credit module <i>Reporting with R Markdown</i>"),


Location = c("[Link](/tasks/9-tasks/#solutions)",
             "[Link](/materials/10-content/#r-walkthrough)",
             "[Link](/materials/10-content/#r-walkthrough)",
             "[Link](/tasks/10-tasks/#homework)^[Due week 12]",
             "[Link](/datacamp/05-module/)",
             "[Link](/datacamp/07-module/)",
             "[Link](/datacamp/08-module/)",
             "[Link](/datacamp/09-module/)")
) %>%
  mutate(Link = paste0("<a href=", str_extract_all(Location, "(?<=\\().+?(?=\\))"), "> <i class='fa-solid fa-link' style='color:#598fff'></i> </a>")) %>%
  select(-Location)
```

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, eval = TRUE, echo = FALSE}
kable(wk_post, 
      escape = FALSE,
      align = 'clc') %>%
  kable_styling(full_width = FALSE)  %>%
  column_spec(1, width = "10em") %>%
  row_spec(0:nrow(wk_post), extra_css = 'vertical-align: middle !important;', background = "#212121", color = "#ffffff")
```
